channel.title: BSD on Welcome to My Site!
channel.description: Recent content in BSD on Welcome to My Site!

item.title: Reviving an ancient BSD UNIX workstation
item.description: Most people will look at this 3-foot-long behemoth of ancient electronics and wonder why it wasnâ€™t scrapped decades ago. But for many of us in the tech industry, these ancient machines are a way to peer into the early days of an industry that has twisted and evolved in leaps and bounds, leaving nearly every player that shaped its landscape forgotten in time. The machine sitting in my driveway at the top of this post is a workstation from the early 1980s with a NS32016 CPU (the first 32-bit general purpose microprocessor) and a whopping 1MB of RAM.
